The Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA) has received a $10 million donation from the George and Grace Bequest Fund. The gift, which was made March 10, marks the first time the fund has ever given to a museum that did not already possess the funds to start a new museum. The Bequest Fund is one of many organizations that have been working with the LA County Museum of Art to define what it means to be a visionary leader in the arts and design.“George and Grace Bequest Fund is a wonderful example of how cultural institutions can serve as powerful catalysts for social change,” said LA County Museum director Howard Ritz, who is also the founder and CEO of the Bequest Fund. “The Bequest Fund has supported the LA County Museum of Art for almost forty years in a very generous way. We are grateful to George and Grace for this extraordinary gift and look forward to transforming the LA County Museum of Art into a truly transformational institution.”
